page.title: 07FARMING
page.content:
{Kerling farm}has 42 acres. 23 acres for hay, 17 acres for corn and 2 acres for grazing. They wait until the hay is ripe then they cut it, dry it and turn it two or three times before bailing and storing in the barn.{ {Kerling farm}have got{3 pigs,}and {10-17 cows}at the most. They buy their cows from market and sell some there too. They feed their cows on hay, grass and pellets which are made of barley. A calf costs from{Â£80}to{Â£180 but a{female calf}costs from{Â£40}to {Â£80.}They also have a{hay cutter, hay {turner, bailer, elevator}and{3 {tractors.}All cows go for Beef.
